intro: Mirbelia pulchella, commonly known as the pretty mirbelia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. Mirbelia pulchella is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to cultivate.
